body: If the current behaviour is desired by the Vagrant team, can it be treated as a breaking change, docs updated, and semver applied accordingly?

Also of note, the vagrantfile in the issue reproduces this issue with `vagrant up --provision`, but not `vagrant provision`, but I can confirm that VVV has this issue when using both commands. The addition of `trigger.run` is what allowed me to reproduce this issue.

In fact without the `.run` parameter, none of the triggers run on `vagrant up --provision` , but they do on `vagrant provision`, but when the `run` parameter is added back, the reverse is true. Eitherway the behaviour between `vagrant provision` and `vagrant up --provision` is inconsistent

issue.title: Track raw actions as they are applied to prevent multiple insertions

repository.name: vagrant
repository.description: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

issue.body:
The raw actions are used for applying the original trigger behavior
which can insert before and/or after the entire set of actions. When
processing the stack items, mark when the raw action has been applied
to prevent it from being applied again. Triggers around the raw actions
should only ever be applied _once_.

Fixes #12034 #12035

body: @chrisroberts I installed that, and got mixed results. 1. the test provisioners triggered when using the basic vagrant file I provided in the issue as expected 2. when using `vagrant up --provision` the pre-provision trigger is not ran, but when using `vagrant provision` it is 3. the `vagrant-goodhosts` plugins output appears multiple times when using `vagrant provision` with the test vagrant file, but not when using `vagrant up --provision`, notice the red line: VVV gave the same results with this general pattern: - goodhosts output x2 - a message about updating boxes or that boxes have already updated - goodhosts output x7 - provisioners - goodhosts output x7 - post vagrant up/provision trigger - goodhosts output x2 It may be coincidental that this vagrant plugin uses 7 hooks https://github.com/goodhosts/vagrant/blob/master/lib/vagrant-goodhosts/plugin.rb#L18-L46, and is based on the vagrant hostsupdater plugin

Also

~/dev/brokenvagrant

```

I've an issue for the error from goodhosts, that can be ignored, but it should only appear once

The multiple trigger execution does not only affect the provisioning.
I have triggers setup before and after "up" that are also executed multiple times:

@tomjn Thanks for the input on this issue and helping to track down the issue. We've gone through and replicated setups you've described using the changes in #12037 and everything appears to be working as expected. Just to address two things you noted:

> when using vagrant up --provision the pre-provision trigger is not ran

This is expected behavior for the default triggers implementation. Triggers are based on the command being run, not the action. With a trigger defined for `:provision`, it will _only_ run when the `vagrant provision` command is run. You can define multiple commands for the trigger to run on (`[:up, :provision]`) if that's the desired behavior.

> the vagrant-goodhosts plugins output appears multiple times

I experienced this output as well, and looking at the plugin setup it _is_ expected based on the hooks usage, however it was likely not previously happening based on the original issues of not all hooks being triggered. 

If you have any other issues/questions with this, please let me know. Otherwise, we should have the new release out soon which includes this fix. Thanks again!

Hi @chrisroberts,

thank you for looking into this issue.

Unfortunately there still seems to be a serious problem with executing triggers with Vagrant version 2.2.13.

My guess is that the triggers for "before up" and "after up" for example are erroneously triggered also before and after provisioning.

It would be great if you could re-open this issue for further investigation. Thank you so much!

Here is a simple example to reproduce:

**Vagrantfile**

```
Vagrant.configure("2") do |config|

  config.vm.box = "geerlingguy/centos7"

  config.trigger.before :up do |trigger|
    trigger.info = "TRIGGER BEFORE UP INFO"
    trigger.run = {inline: "echo 'TRIGGER BEFORE UP RUN'"}
  end

  config.trigger.after :up do |trigger|
    trigger.info = "TRIGGER AFTER UP INFO"
    trigger.run = {inline: "echo 'TRIGGER AFTER UP RUN'"}
  end

  config.vm.provision "shell", run: "always", inline: <<-SHELL
    echo 'PROVISION ALWAYS'
  SHELL

end
```

**vagrant up (version 2.2.10)**

```
Bringing machine 'default' up with 'virtualbox' provider...
==> default: Running action triggers before up ...
==> default: Running trigger...
==> default: TRIGGER BEFORE UP INFO

    default: SSH username: vagrant
    default: SSH auth method: private key
==> default: Machine booted and ready!
==> default: Checking for guest additions in VM...
==> default: Mounting shared folders...

==> default: Machine already provisioned. Run `vagrant provision` or use the `--provision`
==> default: flag to force provisioning. Provisioners marked to run always will still run.
